info.description:
The API allows access to information related to the Netic Kubernetes based platform. The API
is based on JSON-LD for linking relevant data.

Major changes to data structure is indicated through a "v" content type parameter - indicting requested
major version, e.g., "application/json;concept=cluster;v=1". If no parameter is present API will return
the latest resource representation.

Where relevant the API implements standard caching through http such as etag, expiry etc.

APIs will use `application/problem+json` to convey error conditions to clients.

Host: api.k8s.netic.dk
info.title: Netic Cloud API

get.description:
listClusters returns a list of clusters depending on the authorizations of the user.

The returned list will contain all clusters that the user has access to see. Filtering
is done based on the resources listed in the given OAuth 2.0 token. The result is a
partial collection supporting pagination.

400.description: Invalid query parameters, e.g., pagination parameters

500.description: Internal errors communication with backends or other

post.description:
createCluster creates a cluster and returns information on a the created cluster instance

The returned list will contain all cluster that the user has access to see. Filtering
is done based on the resources listed in the given OAuth 2.0 token. The result is a
partial collection supporting pagination.

requestBody.description: The data used to create the cluster

500.description: Internal errors communication with backends or other

get.description:
getCluster returns information on a specific cluster instance.

A cluster represents a Kubernetes cluster operated and managed with the Netic cloud stack. Information
is put into the inventory service prior to the first provisioning of the cluster. Some properties
may be updated based on metadata from the cluster.

404.description: The request instance was not found (or user does not have access)

500.description: Internal errors communication with backends or other

404.description: The request instance was not found (or user does not have access)

500.description: Internal errors communication with backends or other

Cluster.description: Cluster represents a secure cloud stack Kubernetes cluster

@context.description: Context is defining the JSON-LD context for dereferencing the data as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

@id.description: ID is identifying the node with an IRI as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

@included.description: Included will container linked resources included here for convenience

@type.description: Type is optional explicit definition of the type of node as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

apiEndpoint.description: ApiEndpoint is the uri for the Kubernetes api, this may be empty

capacity.description: Capacity is the capacity per node type, i.e., control-plane and worker nodes

components.description: Components is a reference to the collection of components detected to be running in the cluster

description.description: Description is the humanreadable cluster description of the cluster

environmentName.description: EnvironmentName specifies the name of the environment to which the cluster is associated - this is generic determined by the cluster provider and tenants but suggested to be, e.g., "production"

fqdn.description: FQDN is deprecated, was a string identifying the cluster with a DNS valid string often also registered in DNS - this will not be provided going forward please use the NRN

images.description: Images is a reference to the collection of images discovered from the cluster

infrastructureProvider.description: InfrastructureProvider indicates the provider of the underlying infrastructure, e.g., azure, aws, netic etc. it may not be possible to determine the infrastructure provider

kubernetesProvider.description: KubernetesProvider indicates the Kubernetes distribution, e.g., rke2, aks, eks, kubeadm, etc.

name.description: Name uniquely identifying the cluster within the provider of the cluster

namespaces.description: Namespaces is a reference to the collection of namespace for the cluster

nrn.description: NRN is the Netic Resource Name uniquely identifying the cluster among all other Netic resource names

partition.description: Partition specifies the partition in which the cluster is running

provider.description: Provider identification of cluster provider, i.e., the organizational unit responsible for providing the cluster to the tenants

region.description: Region specifies the region in which the cluster is running

resilienceZone.description: ResilienceZone identified the resilienze to which the cluster is associated

subscription.description: Subscription is the Netic subscription identifier used for accounting - this will only be included when the client is authorized for this information

timestamp.description: Timestamp indicating when data was collected

vulnerabilities.description: Vulnerabilities is a reference to the collection of vulnerabilities detected from the cluster

workloads.description: Workloads is a reference to the collection of workloads for the cluster

ClusterType.description: ClusterType specifies the type of cluster sharing

Clusters.description: Clusters represents a collection of clusters

@context.description: Context is defining the JSON-LD context for dereferencing the data as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

@id.description: ID is identifying the node with an IRI as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

@included.description: Included will container linked resources included here for convenience

@type.description: Type is optional explicit definition of the type of node as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

clusters.description: Clusters is the identification of the clusters in the collection

count.description: Count is the number of clusters in the collection

total.description: TotalCount is the total number of clusters

CreateCluster.description: CreateCluster represents the information used to create a secure cloud stack Kubernetes cluster

apiEndpoint.description: APIEndpoint is the URL for the Kubernetes API server endpoint

customOperationsURL.description: CustomOperationsURL is the URL for the site that documents the custom operations for the cluster. This must be et if HasCustomOperations is enabled.

description.description: Description is the humanreadable cluster description of the cluster

environmentName.description: EnvironmentName specifies the name of the environment to which the cluster is associated - this is generic determined by the cluster provider and tenants but suggested to be, e.g., "production"

hasApplicationManagement.description: HasApplicationManagement specifies that the service level of the cluster includes Application Management

hasApplicationOperations.description: HasApplicationOperations specifies that the service level of the cluster includes Application Operations. This must be enabled if HasApplicationManagement is enabled.

hasCustomOperations.description: HasCustomOperations specifies that the service level of the cluster includes Custom Operations. This must en enabled if HasTechnicalManagement is disabled.

hasTechnicalManagement.description: HasTechnicalManagement specifies that the service level of the cluster includes Technical Management. This must be enabled if HasApplicationOperations is enabled.

hasTechnicalOperations.description: HasTechnicalOperations specifies that the service level of the cluster includes Technical Operations. This must be enabled if HasTechnicalManagement is enabled.

infrastructureProvider.description: InfrastructureProvider is the name of the entity that provides the infrastructure for the cluster. One of: "netic", "azure", "aws"

name.description: Name uniquely identifying the cluster within the provider of the cluster

partition.description: Partition is the partition in which the cluster is running. One of: "netic", "azure", "aws"

provider.description: Provider identification of cluster provider, i.e., the organizational unit responsible for providing the cluster to the tenants

region.description: Region is the region within the partition in which the cluster is running

resilienceZone.description: ResilienceZone is the name of the resilience zone the cluster is running in

subscriptionID.description: SubscriptionID is the subscription ID associated with the cluster

Pagination.description: Pagination contains data on other collection data

first.description: First is link to the first page in the collection

last.description: Last is link to the last page in the collection

next.description: Next is link to the next page, if any

prev.description: Prev is link to the previous page, if any

detail.description: Detail is humanreadable explanation of the specific occurence of the problem RFC-9457#3.1.4

instance.description: Instance identifies the specific instance of the problem RFC-9457#3.1.5

status.description: Status is the http status code and must be consistent with the server status code RFC-9457#3.1.2

title.description: Title is short humanreadable summary RFC-9457#3.1.3

Provider.description: Provider models a cluster provider organization

@context.description: Context is defining the JSON-LD context for dereferencing the data as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

@id.description: ID is identifying the node with an IRI as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

@included.description: Included will container linked resources included here for convenience

@type.description: Type is optional explicit definition of the type of node as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

ResilienceZone.description: ResilienceZone models resilience zone for inclusion

Subscription.description: Subscription models a subscription accounting wise

@context.description: Context is defining the JSON-LD context for dereferencing the data as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

@id.description: ID is identifying the node with an IRI as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

@included.description: Included will container linked resources included here for convenience

@type.description: Type is optional explicit definition of the type of node as stated in the JSON-LD specification https://www.w3.org/TR/json-ld/#keywords

name.description: Name is a humanreable name of the subscription

number.description: Number is the identifying property of a subscription

cores.description: CPU is the total amount of allocatable millicores

memory.description: Memory is the total amount of allocatable bytes of memory

nodes.description: Nodes is the total number of nodes

commit.description: Commit is the commit sha of the source code for the binary

date.description: Date is the date the binary was build
